text: "Let's Call It a Day Girl" is a 1966 song which became a hit for Florida-based pop rock group The Razor's Edge. The song was written by Irwin Levine. Bobby Vee also recorded the song, with his rendition becoming a hit three years later. Both Vee's version and The Razor's Edge's version charted in the United States and Canada, with The Razor's Edge having the larger hit in both nations (U.S. #77, Canada #57). The B-side of Vee's record, "I'm Gonna Make It Up to You," also reached the charts (U.S. #132), however, both songs were non-album tracks and neither rendition appeared on an LP. == Other versions == "Let's Call It a Day Girl" was also recorded by The Four Preps in 1966, also a non- album track. == Chart history == ;The Razor's Edge {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !align="left"|Chart (1966) !align="left"|Peak position |- |Canada RPM Top Singles | style="text-align:center;"|57 |- |US Billboard Hot 100Joel Whitburn's Top Pop Singles 1955–1990 – | style="text- align:center;"|77 |- |US Cash Box Top 100 | style="text-align:center;"|72 |- |} ;Bobby Vee {| class="wikitable" |- !align="left"|Chart (1969) !align="left"|Peak position |- |Canada RPM Top Singles | style="text-align:center;"|79 |- |US Billboard Hot 100Joel Whitburn's Top Pop Singles 1955–1990 – | style="text- align:center;"|92 |- |US Cash Box Top 100 | style="text-align:center;"|97 |- |} == References == == External links == * Lyrics of this song * Category:1966 songs Category:1966 singles Category:1969 singles Category:Bobby Vee songs Category:Songs written by Irwin Levine Category:Liberty Records singles Category:Song recordings produced by Snuff Garrett
